required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Cognitive Dual Task and Mental Fatigue on Landing Biomechanics
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Cognitive Dual Task and Mental Fatigue on Landing Biomechanics

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, three-dimensional biomechanics , by means of lower limb joint angles and moments (opto-electronic system with synchronised force plate), of landing tasks (anticipated, unanticipated and cognitive dual task) before and after a mental fatigue protocol will be compared in a population of basketball, handball and volleyball players.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, three-dimensional biomechanics , by means of lower limb joint angles and moments (opto-electronic system with synchronised force plate), of landing tasks (anticipated, unanticipated and cognitive dual task) before and after a mental fatigue protocol will be compared in a population of basketball, handball and volleyball players.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The same day/test moment, immediately after fatiguing exercises
primary_outcome.description: Joint angles will be extracted with an opto-electronic system and synchronised force plate

primary_outcome.time_frame: The same day/test moment, immediately after fatiguing exercises
primary_outcome.description: Joint moments will be extracted with an opto-electronic system and synchronised force plate

arm_group.arm_group_label: Healthy basketball, volleyball and handball players
arm_group.description: Healthy basketball, volleyball and handball players

intervention.description: Landing tasks (anticipated, unanticipated and cognitive dual task) are investigated with 3D analysis by using an opto-electronic system
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy basketball, volleyball and handball players

study_pop.textblock: Healthy volleyball, basketball and handball players

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- volleyball, basketball of handball players
- male
Exclusion Criteria:
- history or surgery of the lower extremities
- history of fractures of the lower extremities
